TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HttpListenerResponse extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class HttpListenerResponse Implements IDisposable
public ref class HttpListenerResponse sealed : IDisposable

summary.span: Represents a response to a request being handled by an object.

span.span: Represents a response to a request being handled by an object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当客户端发出请求的资源由对象时，请求和响应是可用于在应用程序对象。When a client makes a request for a resource handled by an object, the request and response are made available to your application in an object. 表示请求对象，可在属性。The request is represented by an object and is available in the property. 表示响应对象，可在属性。The response is represented by an object and is available in the property. 可以通过设置各种属性，如自定义的响应， ，和。You can customize the response by setting various properties, such as , , and . 使用属性来获取实例可以将数据写入到的响应。Use the property to obtain a instance to which response data can be written. 最后，将响应数据发送到客户端通过调用方法。Finally, send the response data to the client by calling the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Abort() cil managed

summary.span: Closes the connection to the client without sending a response.

span.span: Closes the connection to the client without sending a response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在已关闭的对象上调用此方法不起作用。Calling this method on an object that has already been closed has no effect. 如果尚未结束响应，则此方法关闭它，并关联和对象。If the response has not already been closed, this method closes it and the associated and objects. 客户端的连接也是已关闭，则无论什么客户端请求的属性值。The connection to the client is also closed, regardless of the property value of the client request.

summary.span: Adds the specified header and value to the HTTP headers for this response.

span.span: Adds the specified header and value to the HTTP headers for this response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法相当于调用方法返回的集合上属性。Calling this method is equivalent to calling the method on the collection returned by the property. 如果在指定的标头`name`不存在，此方法将插入到新的标头属性的集合。If the header specified in `name` does not exist, this method inserts a new header into the property's collection. 如果`name`存在于集合中，现有值替换此方法将替换`value`。If `name` is present in the collection, this method replaces the existing value with `value`. 若要将值添加到现有标头，而无需替换现有值，请使用方法。To add a value to an existing header without replacing the existing value, use the method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何添加使用此属性的标头。The following code example demonstrates adding a header using this property. summary.span: Gets or sets the collection of cookies returned with the response.

span.span: Gets or sets the collection of cookies returned with the response.

value.span: 一个包含随响应返回的 cookie。

span.span: A that contains cookies to accompany the response.

value.span: 如果集合为空任何 cookie 已添加到响应。

span.span: The collection is empty if no cookies have been added to the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Cookie 是名称/值存储在本地 （客户端） 计算机的 Web 服务器从文本数据。A cookie is name/value text data from a Web server that is stored on the local (client) computer. 支持以下 cookie 格式： Netscape、 RFC 2109 和 RFC 2965。The following cookie formats are supported: Netscape, RFC 2109, and RFC 2965. Netscape cookie 规范位于http://wp.netscape.com/newsref/std/cookie_spec.html; 的 RFC 文档目前[ https://www.rfc-editor.org/ ](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。The Netscape cookie specification is available at http://wp.netscape.com/newsref/std/cookie_spec.html; the RFC documents are available at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的代码示例检查 cookie 的请求，并返回与响应新的 cookie，如果请求没有。The following code example checks a request for a cookie, and returns a new cookie with the response if the request did not have one. [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#20](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#20)]

span.span: The instance to copy.

summary.span: Copies properties from the specified to this response.

span.span: Copies properties from the specified to this response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果定期将许多属性从其默认值更改为一组固定的新值，可以方便地使用作为模板的实例。If you regularly change many properties from their default values to a fixed set of new values, it is convenient to use an instance as a template. 自定义模板响应一次和，而不是单独配置每个响应，请调用方法来配置新的响应根据模板响应中的属性值。Customize the template response once and, instead of configuring each response separately, call the method to configure a new response based on property values in the template response. 从复制以下属性`templateResponse`到当前实例。The following properties are copied from `templateResponse` to the current instance. - - - - - - ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何通过复制模板响应创建响应。The following code example demonstrates creating a response by copying a template response. [!code-csharp[NCLListener#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLListener/CS/sample.cs#5)] [!code-vb[NCLListener#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLListener/vb/sample.vb#5)]

member this.Headers : System.Net.WebHeaderCollection with get, set

summary.span: Gets or sets the collection of header name/value pairs returned by the server.

span.span: Gets or sets the collection of header name/value pairs returned by the server.

value.span: 一个实例，它包含所有显式设置 HTTP 标头包含在响应中。

span.span: A instance that contains all the explicitly set HTTP headers to be included in the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 响应标头包含元数据信息，如日期和响应时间、 响应的服务器，并在响应正文中包含的数据的 MIME 类型的标识。Response headers contain metadata information such as the date and time of the response, the identity of the responding server, and the MIME type of the data contained in the response body. 响应标头的完整列表，请参阅枚举。For a complete list of response headers, see the enumeration. > [!NOTE] > 如果您尝试将设置内容长度保持活动状态、 传输编码，否则将引发 Www-authenticate 标头使用的标头属性，异常。If you attempt to set a Content-Length, Keep-Alive, Transfer-Encoding, or WWW-Authenticate header using the Headers property, an exception will be thrown. 使用或属性来设置这些标头。Use the or properties to set these headers. 不能手动设置的传输编码或 Www-authenticate 标头。You cannot set the Transfer-Encoding or WWW-Authenticate headers manually. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何显示中的标头。The following code example demonstrates displaying the headers in a . [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#23](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#23)]

exception.span: The instance specified for a set operation is not valid for a response.

member this.KeepAlive : bool with get, set

summary.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server requests a persistent connection.

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the server requests a persistent connection.

value.span: 如果服务器请求的持续性连接;，否则为。

span.span: if the server requests a persistent connection; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 HTTP 客户端和服务器预期在短时间内多次交换数据，持续性连接允许用户以避免打开和关闭每条消息的 TCP 连接所需的开销，从而加快其通信。If an HTTP client and server expect to exchange data multiple times in a short period, a persistent connection speeds up their communications by allowing them to avoid the overhead required to open and close a TCP connection for each message. 持久连接已被广泛采用现代 Web 浏览器和 Web 服务器之间通信。Persistent connections are in widespread use in communications between modern Web browsers and Web servers. 在 HTTP/1.1 协议规范 (RFC 2616) RTF 编辑器网站上可用的详细描述了永久连接 ([https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/))。Persistent connections are described in detail in the HTTP/1.1 protocol specification (RFC 2616) available at the RTF Editor Web site ([https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置此属性的值。The following code example demonstrates setting the value of this property. [!code-csharp[NclListener#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLListener/CS/sample.cs#7)] [!code-vb[NclListener#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/NCLListener/vb/sample.vb#7)]

summary.span: Gets or sets whether the response uses chunked transfer encoding.

span.span: Gets or sets whether the response uses chunked transfer encoding.

value.span: 如果响应设置为使用 chunked 的传输编码;否则为。

span.span: if the response is set to use chunked transfer encoding; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 分块的消息的正文由一系列的区块组成。The body of a chunked message is made up of a series of chunks. 每个区块包含两个部分 — 区块数据和实际数据的大小。Each chunk comprises of two parts—the size of the chunk data and the actual data. 如果设置为 true，响应使用发送分块传输编码。When set to true the response is sent using chunked transfer encoding.

summary.span: Adds or updates a in the collection of cookies sent with this response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 两个 cookie 将被视为相同的值及其， ，和属性都是相同。Two cookies are considered the same if the values of their , , and properties are the same. 如果这三个条信息是相同的该方法将尝试更新 cookie。If these three pieces of information are the same, the method attempts to update the cookie. 名称和域比较不区分大小写，但路径比较不区分大小写。The name and domain comparisons are not case sensitive, but the path comparison is case sensitive. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何调用此方法。The following code example demonstrates calling this method. [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#28](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#28)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int StatusCode { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.StatusCode : int with get, set

summary.span: Gets or sets the HTTP status code to be returned to the client.

span.span: Gets or sets the HTTP status code to be returned to the client.

value.span: 值，该值指定所请求的资源的 HTTP 状态代码。

span.span: An value that specifies the HTTP status code for the requested resource.

value.span: 默认值是，指示服务器已成功处理客户端的请求，并在响应正文中包含所请求的资源。

span.span: The default is , indicating that the server successfully processed the client's request and included the requested resource in the response body.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 客户端使用由服务器返回的状态代码来决定如何继续操作。Clients use the status code returned by the server to decide how to proceed. 值为指示服务器已成功处理客户端的请求，并在响应正文中包含所请求的资源。A value of indicates that the server successfully processed the client's request and included the requested resource in the response body. 其他常见的状态代码包括，，该值指示在服务器上找不到请求的资源和，指出这不必要的响应正文中返回所请求的资源，因为客户端缓存的副本资源是最新状态。Other common status codes include , indicating that the requested resource was not found on the server, and , indicating that it was unnecessary to return the requested resource in the response body because the client's cached copy of the resource is up-to-date. 有关可能的状态代码的完整列表，请参阅枚举。For a complete list of possible status codes, see the enumeration. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置此属性的值。The following code example demonstrates setting the value of this property. [!code-csharp[Net_Listener_Basic#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Net_Listener_Basic/CS/test.cs#7)]

span.span: The text description of the HTTP status code returned to the client.

value.span: 默认值是 RFC 2616 说明属性值或空字符串 ("") 如果不存在 RFC 2616 说明。

span.span: The default is the RFC 2616 description for the property value, or an empty string ("") if an RFC 2616 description does not exist.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 状态说明通常提供了详细说明信息值。The status description typically provides details that explain the value. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何设置此属性的值。The following code example demonstrates setting the value of this property.
